main event: Multiple sightings of bright light objects were reported in East Lansing, Michigan on 23 May 1964, which were identified as potential meteor observations.
interesting points: The first sighting involved a brilliant white light moving from east to west across a 30 degree arc, lasting 2-3 seconds before disappearing., A Corporal from Michigan State Police observed the light describing it as brighter than Venus and winking out suddenly., Additional witnesses included students from Michigan State University who described a similar sight of a silvery disc at a 45 degree angle., The brightness of the object was noted to be steady, and it made no sound during observation., Investigators considered the possibility of the sightings being misidentified meteors or planets, yet the reported behavior of the object suggested otherwise.
sighted object: brilliant white light and silvery disc-like object
witness description: University students and local police personnel
